rev.comment: /* Blocking traffic */ Neutral heading-- agree there's may be a minor controversy in this, but 'blocking traffic' by itself is not controversial
rev.diff:
Line 151: Line 151:
Journalist Susie Cagle was arrested in the early hours of November 3, jailed, and ultimately charged with a misdemeanor. Cagle subsequently reported having observed mistreatment of protestors during their imprisonment.<ref name=Cagle>[http://www.alternet.org/story/152990/police_state_in_oakland_one_reporter%27s_arrest_contradicts_official_story/?page=entire]</ref>
Journalist Susie Cagle was arrested in the early hours of November 3, jailed, and ultimately charged with a misdemeanor. Cagle subsequently reported having observed mistreatment of protestors during their imprisonment.<ref name=Cagle>[http://www.alternet.org/story/152990/police_state_in_oakland_one_reporter%27s_arrest_contradicts_official_story/?page=entire]</ref>
â
===Blocking traffic===
+
===Nov 3 traffic incident===
On November 3, a driver of a Mercedes who had a green light struck two protestors who were in the street blocking traffic. The two protestors were taken to the hospital with minor injuries. The driver was questioned by BART police and released, angering protesters who witnessed the events and called for the driver's arrest. <ref>{{cite news|last=Kuruvila|first=Matthai|title=Mercedes hits 2 Occupy Oakland protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/03/BA5G1LQ06S.DTL|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
On November 3, a driver of a Mercedes who had a green light struck two protestors who were in the street blocking traffic. The two protestors were taken to the hospital with minor injuries. The driver was questioned by BART police and released, angering protesters who witnessed the events and called for the driver's arrest. <ref>{{cite news|last=Kuruvila|first=Matthai|title=Mercedes hits 2 Occupy Oakland protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/03/BA5G1LQ06S.DTL|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
